item.title: Former PlayStation Boss Reveals The One Classic Sony Franchise He Wants To See Return
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/former-playstation-boss-reveals-the-one-classic-sony-franchise-he-wants-to-see-return/1100-6528202/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Longtime PlayStation boss Shawn Layden left the company in 2019, and he recently gave an interview about the PlayStation's 30th anniversary. In that interview he touched on a great number of topics, and he also revealed the one classic PlayStation franchise he'd like to see Sony return to one day.

Layden told Eurogamer that he would like to see the MediEvil series make a comeback for modern audiences. He said the game spoke to him the first time he saw it and he was a big fan of the team behind it, so much so that he helped get a sequel out the door and eventually a remaster on PS4.

"I would love another whack at MediEvil," he said.

The original MediEvil, released in 1998, began its development at Millennium before Sony acquired the studio and created a team called SCE Studio Cambridge. This studio later became Guerrilla Cambridge and eventually closed its doors in 2017.

MediEvil - Story Gameplay Trailer

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

The MediEvil series was inspired by the work of Tim Burton and Monty Python, and Layden noted that it was "really hard" to make the comedy work for other audiences with localization. A sequel, MediEvil 2, was released in 2000, with a PSP release, MediEvil: Resurrection, landing in 2005. A remake of the first game from Other Ocean Emeryville was released in 2019 for PS4.

"If I could wave a magic wand and have one more bite at an apple, it would be the MediEvil apple," Layden said.

Also in the interview, Layden revealed the one game he was jealous of from a rival platform--Tomb Raider. When he was working in Tokyo during the PS1 days, Layden's job was to help bring Western titles to Japan, and when he saw Tomb Raider from Derby-based Core Design, he wanted it to be a PlayStation game from the start. He didn't get his way, however, as 1996's Tomb Raider debuted as an exclusive to Sega Saturn before coming to PlayStation.

"I wanted it to be on PlayStation. And I saw the [Core Design Jeremy Heath-Smith and Adrian Smith] brothers, and we talked about it, and they were really excited about the concept. We talked it through. They talked it through. Bada bing, bada boom... they signed to bring it out on Sega Saturn. Sega?!" Layden said. "And then shortly thereafter, they did get it onto the PlayStation in Japan as well, but it launched on Sega. And yeah, that always felt... What could I have done to have actually gotten it? But I came that close."

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: GTA Online Debuts Trailer And Release Date For Next Expansion
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/gta-online-debuts-trailer-and-release-date-for-next-expansion/1100-6528201/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

While everyone is waiting for a new Grand Theft Auto 6 trailer, Rockstar Games has gone ahead and unveiled the next expansion for Grand Theft Auto Online. Starting on December 10, players will be able to start Agents of Sabotage, a new story that introduces a renegade ex-Federal Investigation Bureau agent who is all too happy to help set up some high-stakes robberies. The first trailer for expansion sets the tone for everything to come.

The name of the rogue FIB operative is Jodi Marshall, and she is apparently holding quite a grudge against her former employers. More importantly, Jodi has maintained her access to sensitive FIB files, which can deliver some very valuable intel to players. In partnership with Jodi, players can take over the Darnell Bros Garment Factory and use it as a staging ground for new crimes. This expansion is also bringing back Pavel, a supporting character who appeared in The Cayo Perico Heist expansion four years ago.

Meanwhile, Netflix is set to remove Grand Theft Auto 3 - The Definitive Edition and Grand Theft Auto: Vice City - The Definitive Edition on December 13. GTA: San Andreas will apparently remain on the streamer for now. This move comes a few weeks after the console versions of Grand Theft Auto: The Trilogy â€“ The Definitive Edition received a long-awaited visual update.

According to Rockstar, Grand Theft Auto 6 is still on track to launch in 2025, and GTA Online will presumably continue to be supported as well. However, it's unclear what the future holds for that game once GTA 6 becomes the gold standard of the franchise.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Call Of Duty's Best Stoner DLC Yet Turns You Into A Pot-Smoking Lizard
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/call-of-dutys-best-stoner-dlc-yet-turns-you-into-a-pot-smoking-lizard/1100-6528200/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Activision has announced what's coming to Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 and Warzone for the holiday season, and while there are plenty of festive updates planned, one store bundle in particular stands out.

The "Dank Days" Tracer Pack is themed around one of Call of Duty's most enduringly popular activities: smoking pot. The bundle invites players to "coast through the holiday season" with plenty of weed-themed items, including the "Bongshot" Mastercraft blueprint for the KSV SMG. Intriguingly, Activision said the visual effects of this weapon "intensify" with successive kills. No footage has been released so far, but it seems like this could be in reference to some kind of "trippy" visual effects.

Also in the bundle is the "Blunty" operator skin, which turns your character into some kind of lizard. Then there's the "Blunt Trauma" LMG blueprint for the GPMG-7, as well as the "Weed Wacker" A.G.R. MK 1 scorestreak skin, in addition to the "Toke-a-Bloke" finishing move. The DLC also comes with the "Aim High" weapon reticle, the "My Bong" weapon charm," and "Pass It" spray, and the "Greener Grass" loading screen.

As mentioned, the Call of Duty series has featured marijuana-themed content for a long time now. In 2023's Modern Warfare III, Activision brought the legendary stoners Cheech and Chong to the game as part of an event called Blaze Up. Activision even got the comedians themselves to do the voices.

For more on what's coming to Black Ops 6/Warzone Season 1 Reloaded this December, check out the gallery below.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: You Can Preload Infinity Nikki Now, As Cozy Game Gets New Launch Trailer
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/you-can-preload-infinity-nikki-now-as-cozy-game-gets-new-launch-trailer/1100-6528199/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Just a couple of days away from launch, preloading is now available for Infinity Nikki on PS5, Epic Games Store, and mobile platforms. Developer Infold Games has also announced new rewards for players when they start their adventure in the open-world fashion title, such as a special stylist background and two four-star outfits.

In addition, a new release trailer--seen below--sets up the plot for the stylist's adventure in Infinity Nikki. Apparently, wishes used to flourish in Miraland, but after a thousand years, they now just lead to despair. Nikki has the ability to heal the world, along with her cute companion, Momo.

Last month, Infold revealed that Infinity Nikki would come out on December 5. The game's sub-director is Kentaro Tominaga, who previously worked on The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild and Mario Kart Wii. The staff also includes veterans who contributed to The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt and Alice: Madness Returns.

Infold is promising that Infinity Nikki will offer styling contests, fishing, wine-cellar minecarts, and ghost trains. We've previously seen bug-hunting and on-the-fly outfit changes in videos, as well.

Infinity Nikki looks wildly popular before releasing later this week. Infold notes the open-world title has over 30 million pre-registrations. For those unfamiliar, Nikki has starred in popular mobile games previously, like Love Nikki and Shining Nikki. For more, here's everything to know about Infinity Nikki.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
